name: Unchained
title: The Challenges of SWIFT and Fraud
text:
Synopsis
Swift payments for digital asset companies are prohibitively expensive, creating a market dynamic where only the riskiest actors are willing to use the payment rail due to exorbitant transaction fees.

Key Insights
- Global banks supporting Swift payments for digital asset companies charge extremely high fees, around 30 basis points
- For large transactions of hundreds of thousands of dollars, banking fees can amount to hundreds or thousands of dollars per payment
- The high cost structure incentivizes only the riskiest market participants to use Swift for digital asset transactions
- There are indications of increased fraud on Swift's digital asset payment rail
